forms.document_type: patient registration form with HIPAA acknowledgement

access_pathway.primary_pathway_description: Patient is directed from SEMG website to MediCopy, a third-party ROI vendor, to complete a generic authorization form that does not distinguish patient self-access from third-party release.

red_flags: SSN (last 4 digits) collected without HIPAA justification
No submission instructions on the PDF form itself
Registration packet includes $10-$150 per-form ASF fee schedule that could be applied to records requests
bright_spots: Plain-language, question-based section headers lower cognitive barrier
Opt-out exclusion model for sensitive record categories (substance abuse, HIV/STDs, psychiatric)
Email listed as first delivery method, positioning electronic delivery as default
MediCopy offers fully digital HelloSign online authorization as alternative to PDF

findability.rationale: Level 3: requires moderate effort — FAQ answers the question helpfully with a MediCopy link, but the forms page omits ROI, and direct searches fail; patient must follow a redirect chain to a third-party site.

technical_accessibility.rationale: Level 3: usable digitally with workarounds — primary PDF has zero fillable fields requiring print-and-handwrite, but MediCopy offers a HelloSign online alternative and fax/email delivery methods are available.

content_design.rationale: Level 4: well-organized with minor issues — single-page form with clear logical flow, plain-language question headers, and good record-type granularity; minor issues include missing submission instructions and SSN collection.

patient_centeredness.rationale: Level 3: a patient can use the process but it wasn't designed for them — 'Personal Use' is one of five purpose options on a generic third-party authorization form with no mention of HIPAA Right of Access or patient-specific rights.

compliance.rationale: Level 3: some requirements that may go beyond what the law requires — SSN collection is unnecessary for patient access, fee disclosure is vague, and the registration packet's $10-$150 ASF schedule could encompass records requests exceeding HIPAA cost-based limits.

overall.summary: SEMG provides a functional records request pathway via MediCopy but does not differentiate patient self-access from third-party release; the generic form has good content design but lacks fillable fields, submission instructions, and transparent fee disclosure.
